definitions.definition: A telephone conversation.
A short visit, usually for social purposes.
definitions.example: I paid a call to a dear friend of mine.

definitions.definition: A visit by a ship or boat to a port.
definitions.example: The ship made a call at Southampton.

definitions.definition: A cry or shout.
definitions.example: He heard a call from the other side of the room.

definitions.definition: A decision or judgement.
The characteristic cry of a bird or other animal.
definitions.example: That sound is the distinctive call of the cuckoo bird.

definitions.definition: A beckoning or summoning.
definitions.example: I had to yield to the call of the wild.

definitions.definition: The right to speak at a given time during a debate or other public event; the floor.
definitions.example: I give the call to the Manager of Opposition Business.

definitions.definition: An option to buy stock at a specified price during or at a specified time.
The act of calling to the other batsman.
The state of being the batsman whose role it is to call (depends on where the ball goes.)
A work shift which requires one to be available when requested (see on call).
The act of jumping to a subprogram, saving the means to return to the original point.
A statement of a particular state, or rule, made in many games such as bridge, craps, jacks, and so on.
definitions.example: There was a 20 dollar bet on the table, and my call was 9.

definitions.definition: The act of matching a bet made by a player who has previously bet in the same round of betting.
A note blown on the horn to encourage the dogs in a hunt.
A whistle or pipe, used by the boatswain and his mate to summon the sailors to duty.
A pipe or other instrument to call birds or animals by imitating their note or cry. A game call.
An invitation to take charge of or serve a church as its pastor.
Vocation; employment; calling.
A reference to, or statement of, an object, course, distance, or other matter of description in a survey or grant requiring or calling for a corresponding object, etc., on the land.
(prostitution) A meeting with a client for paid sex; hookup; job.
(heading) To use one's voice.
(heading) To visit.
(heading) To name, identify or describe.
(heading) Direct or indirect use of the voice.
(sometimes with for) To require, demand.
definitions.example: He felt called to help the old man.

definitions.definition: To announce the early extinction of a debt by prepayment, usually at a premium.
To demand repayment of a loan.
To jump to (another part of a program) to perform some operation, returning to the original point on completion.
definitions.example: A recursive function is one that calls itself.
